text:
Hello!
Is this possible to grey out and disable submit button in HubSpot forms until all the fields required fields get filled in without coding?

Hi

I’m running a clean up of my properties.
Is is possible to get an export of contact properties but with a count for the number of contacts with a value against each property?
Perhaps i can make a call using the api?

Hi channel. I am new to HubSpot and I was assigned this task:
My clients want to be able to track their users' events on their websites. For this, my solution is to create an application in HubSpot and send <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline#endpoint?spec=POST-/crm/v3/timeline|Timeline events>, then have a way for my clients to integrate their HubSpot account with my HubSpot application and thus be able to receive all the events of their users directly in their HubSpot account. Is this how it should be done?

PS: I thought I could change the integration of `Timeline events` for `Segment`, but it seems that I must improve my HubSpot account to `Marketing Hub Enterprise` and it is to expensive

Please any opinions are welcome

It sounds like your idea would satisfy the request.

However this might be an over-engineered solution... to know for sure, it would take more discovery with the client to know what option might best suit them.

Depending on level of detail required from the client, they might just need the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|HS tracking code installed> and maybe use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events|custom behavioral events> for any detailed analytics that the tracking code doesn't already give you– which would be a more straightforward way to add tracking to a HubSpot website (or third party website like WP)–– without needing to build two HubSpot applications (the difference in dev requirement is quite large)

Hi everyone! :wave:

I have a page displaying a quiz that shows the result after submitting the form. I’m looking for a way to save the quiz result (made in custom module) in a custom property contact.
I thought maybe working with a workflow could work, any opinions?

Thanks a lot

For this, I'd recommend a custom object created at the end of the quiz to save the quiz result and associate it to the contact

You could achieve this by utilizing HubSpot's APIs
I think the same thing might also be achievable with custom behavioral events

:sparkling_heart: :hugs: :rotating_light:

_This not directed to any one individual or a response to anything recently posted in this channel._ 

Hey all - just putting this out there as a general reminder. While we all have bad days, let's try to *stay friendly in our responses*. We're all just doing our best and kindness goes a long way!

Remember, by participating in this Slack community, you agree to adhere to our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|Code of Conduct> and the HubSpot principles of HEART (Humble, Empathetic, Adaptable, Remarkable, Transparent)

the E for Empathetic means: Don’t just be understanding of someone's comments, also act with compassion and respect for all.

:sparkling_heart: :hugs: :rotating_light:

I have a question about editing a blog's theme settings, specifically in a header. When we go to decrease the font size, the effects don't seem to take place. Would anybody know what would cause this?

there are quite a few possibilities:

1. the developer has hard-coded the styling of the header elements. 
2. the theme field values aren’t incorporated into the CSS of the header elements. 
3. there’s some other CSS taking precedence over the styling connected to the header theme fields.

How would a PHP developer who knows Javascript  become a HubSpot CMS expert or at least functional in 60 days? 

Other than the usual resources available in HubSpot developer site , what other training videos or code camps are there?
